image.altText: Two police officers walk near the scene of the collision in Kambah.

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old woman has died after a single vehicle crash in Canberra's south.

title.children: Woman dies after single vehicle crash in Canberra parking lot

image.altText: A boat can be seen almost entirely submerged in a lake, trees lining the bank.

props.synopsis: Police said the passengers were on a cruise around lake when the boat began to take on water.

title.children: Twelve rescued from sinking boat on Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin

image.altText: a woman sets a table in a restaurant

props.synopsis: Caitlin Baker is an accomplished sommelier, but that doesn't mean she's always treated respectfully by customers or colleagues.

title.children: 'I want to talk to a man': Female hospitality workers call out sexism

image.altText: Werri beach gerringong

props.synopsis: A woman found unresponsive in the water at Gerringong on the New South Wales south coast and was unable to be revived. Two 13-year-old lifesavers have been praised for their attempts to save her.

title.children: Woman, 66, dies after being pulled from the surf at NSW South Coast beach

image.altText: A bride and groom kiss walk through their wedding ceremony wearing running gear.

props.synopsis: Elspeth Nicholls and Collin Acton got married immediately after their weekly pilgrimage to their local parkrun in Canberra.

title.children: Couple tie the knot at Parkrun after racing down 5km aisle

image.altText: A man stands in a Christmas tree farm wearing a wide-brim hat.

props.synopsis: For many the trek to the nearest Christmas tree farm to choose a tree is as much a part of the holiday season as Christmas dinner.

title.children: The six-year process to grow the perfect real Christmas tree

image.altText: Destroyed bus front on road way with rear of truck involved in foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: A fatal accident involving a bus in southern New South Wales prompts call for a national campaign on bus seatbelt safety.

title.children: Seatbelts on buses comes under scrutiny after Hume Highway crash

image.altText: A woman with a wound on her elbow.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of cases of flesh-eating Buruli ulcer have been reported in Victoria this year, a new study has named a NSW tourist town as the next potential hotspot and has warned of possible spread along NSW coastline

title.children: NSW tourist town named as next hotspot for flesh-eating ulcer

image.altText: Image of a Foxtel logo.

props.synopsis: Pay TV platform Foxtel is sold for $3.4 billion to a British streaming outfit, while the ASX opens 0.6 per cent higher. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Foxtel sold for $3.4 billion, ASX opens higher

image.altText: The Slovakian prime minister and Russian president shaking hands in an ornate ballroom in the Kremlin.

props.synopsis: Robert Fico meets with the Russian president amid concerns about his country's gas supplies, and at a time when Slovakia is withdrawing support for Ukraine's war effort.

title.children: Slovak PM visits Putin hours after Russia threatens Ukraine

props.synopsis: It's still one of Australia's worst disasters. Now, 50 years on, survivors of Cyclone Tracy share their incredible tales of the night Darwin was blown away.

title.children: 'We must be the only people alive': Survivors relive the eerie aftermath of Cyclone Tracy

image.altText: Australia bowler Annabel Sutherland appeals for a wicket in an ODI against New Zealand.

props.synopsis: Annabel Sutherland scores 42 and takes three wickets as Australia wraps up a 75-run win over New Zealand in the third ODI in Wellington. Follow live.

title.children: Sutherland's golden summer continues as Australia wins third ODI in NZ

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia wins by 75 runs and claims the Rose Bowl series 2-0

image.altText: Tyson Fury looks down

props.synopsis: Tyson Fury and Frank Warren were both unhappy at the scoring in the unified heavyweight world title bout with Oleksandr Usyk. But was the scoring that bad?

title.children: Fury fumed at his heavyweight title defeat, but it was not a robbery

image.altText: An empty German Christmas market cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: André Gleissner was a member of a children's fire brigade near Magdeburg, the city where Friday's attack took place.

title.children: Authorities name nine-year-old boy killed in German market attack

image.altText: A line up of nightriders on motorbikes wait at an intersection in Jakarta.

props.synopsis: In Jakarta, police are increasingly struggling to combat the dangerous trend of street drag racing. Groups of mainly young men regularly tear down the streets, risking serious injury. And there's little police can do.

title.children: The scourge of teenage night riders in Jakarta is keeping residents awake

image.altText: a woman crouching with a border collie in frnot of an old wagon, in a field

props.synopsis: Investigations into the death of a Queensland firefighter will likely assess the lack of thermal imaging cameras on the day, as well as issues with training and torches, according to emergency service sources.

title.children: Investigations into death of firefighter to probe whether rescue was delayed

image.altText: A man peers through an opening in a chamber

props.synopsis: The UN investigative body for Syria says it's possible "more than enough" evidence will be found to convict people of crimes against international law.

title.children: UN expects 'more than enough' proof for Syria war crime prosecutions

image.altText: Pouring Red wine into a glass, boutique winery

props.synopsis: Is alcohol in moderation better for your health than none? Or is that a myth? We decant the latest evidence and what it tells us about the effects of a daily tipple.

title.children: A discredited decades-old study is still affecting alcohol consumption today

image.altText: A man in a police uniform stands with other police officers. One is wearing a green Grinch outfit.

props.synopsis: An undercover police officer dressed as the famous Dr Seuss character went "unnoticed" before dismantling a drug trafficking gang in Lima.

title.children: Police officer dressed as the Grinch leads drug bust in Peru

image.altText: Tourists walk down the beach on Maya Bay

props.synopsis: From Wellington to Wales, more and more countries are taxing tourists. But will they stop travellers from coming?

title.children: From Wellington to Wales, more and more countries are trying to tax their tourists

image.altText: A police vehicle parked out the front of a house, with the crime scene cordoned off by tape.

props.synopsis: A woman found dead north of Brisbane overnight may have been chased down by two men before being assaulted and shot, according to police.

title.children: Woman found dead with gunshot wound as police hunt for suspects

image.altText: A group of children stand in a shadowy balcony ledge, with an injured boy with a head bandage looking directly at the camera

props.synopsis: Hamas officials say a ceasefire agreement is "closer than ever" as talks continue with Israel to end the war.

title.children: Ceasefire 'closer than ever' in Gaza as Israel orders besieged hospital to shut

image.altText: crowd of people stand around big water fountain with blue water

props.synopsis: The popular tourist attraction in Rome has reopened ahead of a massive religious event which is expected to draw millions of visitors.

title.children: Rome's Trevi Fountain reopens after months of renovations

image.altText: A screen shot of a snow camera

props.synopsis: As much of the country swelters, a cold front has brought snow to parts of NSW, delighting locals and visitors.

title.children: Surprise snow flurries an 'early present' for locals in NSW alps

image.altText: close up of woman working on laptop with christmas decorations around her

props.synopsis: There is anecdotal evidence that "non-parents feel pressure to pick up the slack" — like working over Christmas — when those with caring responsibilities are unavailable, experts say.

title.children: The pressure to work holiday periods when you don't have kids

image.altText: Residents chatting gathered around a table in a community gathering space.

props.synopsis: Residents of Perth's northernmost corridor, whose nearest hospital is a 30 minute drive away, say the booming population’s access to healthcare has been "forgotten" by the state government.

title.children: 'Forgotten' residents in Perth's north call for new hospital in 'healthcare blackhole'

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The Whyalla council sends take-down letters to residents, including admins of a local Facebook group, over social media posts it alleges are defamatory.

title.children: SA council accused of attempt to 'muzzle' residents with legal threats

image.altText: A man with glasses smiles for a photo in a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Despite knowing he had ADHD and years of experience in bureaucracy as a political staffer, Simon Behrakis still found navigating the medical system "really difficult". Now, he wants to change that.

title.children: How a Liberal MP's battle to receive ADHD treatment sparked an inquiry

image.altText: A woman in a white tulle dress with her pinned back and holding a bouquet stands, smiling.

props.synopsis: Emma Wilson was feeling a sense of dread while struggling to find the perfect wedding dress until her students stepped in to save the day.

title.children: Students make 'perfect' wedding dress after overhearing teacher's dilemma

image.altText: Bogged car in outback New South Wales

props.synopsis: On the red dirt roads of the outback, something as simple as a flat tyre or getting bogged can quickly become a life-or-death situation. Would you know what to do?

title.children: Police warn outback road trips are 'not like driving in the city'

image.altText: A row of tiny, self-contained homes with timber exterior built around greenery

props.synopsis: A once-empty suburban lot in Adelaide has been transformed into a village of tiny homes to support young people transitioning out of the child and family protection system.

title.children: In this village of tiny homes, young people find their independence

image.altText: Tiger Woods celebrates with Charlie Woods

props.synopsis: Charlie Woods — who hit his first career hole-in-one to the delight of his dad Tiger — was not the only son of a major winner to come up aces on the day.

title.children: Watch Charlie Woods, 15yo son of Tiger, hit his first hole-in-one

image.altText: Person standing in white suit, purple hair that goes to black and is chest length.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Samuel Wellings, now known as Kim Dracula, saw the potential for TikTok to help them reach new audiences. It's led to a co-headline tour in the US and a feature on a concept album by the creator of Broadway musical Hamilton.

title.children: Kim Dracula covered a song at home and became an international star

image.altText: An unsmiling white man with short cropped brown hair, sideburns and blue eyes, wearing a black shirt

props.synopsis: When the controversial author's mother died in 1988, she left behind a stack of diaries — now the basis of his new, no-holds-barred novel, Elaine, about a frustrated 50s housewife.

title.children: Will Self's latest novel is based on his mother's 'disturbing' diaries
